By James Bithell

Kate Mitchell reviews the mesmerising and majestic Sigur Ros

Festival Review: Reading 2013

The 2013 edition of Reading Festival offering a surprising variation of sounds and an exciting variety of new stages. The organisers absolutely pulled it off, writes Rosie Shields.

Festival Review: Galtres Festival

Tom Witherow was at Galtres, a small acoustic focussed festival in North Yorkshire that showcased the extraordinary range of music that the North East produces

Album Review: The Civil Wars

By James Bithell

Amidst the melancholia of a partnership gone amiss comes forth a gritty masterpiece, says Katrina Northern

By James Bithell

By James Bithell

This weekend one of North Yorkshire's biggest festivals lands in the grounds of Duncombe Park House. Tom Witherow looks ahead to see what's on offer.

Album Review: Yeezus vs. Magna Carta Holy Grail

By James Bithell

Two of rap and hip hop's biggest titans have released albums within a fortnight of each other. Alex Donaldson weighs up their contrasting sounds.

Sounds From Home: Darwin Deez Live

By James Bithell

Sounds From Home is a new series from Nouse Music exploring the musical happenings of our writers' hometowns. In its first edition, Hatti Linnell reviews Darwin Deez, live in Kingston.

Live Review: Mumford and Sons' Summer Stampede

By James Bithell

After closing this year's Glastonbury Festival Mumford and his boys play a summer series entitled 'Summer Stampede'. Adam Highland was at the newly-christened Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park to review.

Album Review: Jimmy Eat World - Damage

By James Bithell

Jimmy Eat World's 'Damage' speaks of emotional turmoil in a new, stripped down tone; Katrina Northern reviews

Album Review: Goo Goo Dolls - Magnetic

By James Bithell

Goo Goo Dolls' new album is imbued with a nu-wave vivacity; Katrina Northern reviews

Live Review: Bonobo

By James Bithell

'Simon Green and his band are one of the most consistently entertaining acts I have seen live.' Rory Foster reviews.

Album Review: Disclosure - Settle

By James Bithell

Disclosure have produced a club album that you can actually listen to sober again and again. Alex Donaldson reviews.

By James Bithell

Review: Gin and Juice

By James Bithell

After York's extended break from the 90s, Gin & Juice returned for one night only. Rory Foster reviews.

Live Review: Alt-J

By James Bithell

Alt-J kept the audience enraptured through musical skill, without having to resort to crude showmanship, writes James Bailey.

Album Review: Daft Punk - Random Access Memories

By James Bithell

Daft Punk have either redefined the dance genre with the comeback of live musicians or accidentally just made the greatest pop album of the decade so far. Alex Donaldson reviews.

Album Review: Vampire Weekend: Modern Vampires of the City

By James Bithell

Nouse's Callum Reilly reviews Vampire Weekend's hotly anticipated new LP.

Album Review: Bibio - Silver Wilkinson

By James Bithell

Silver Wilkinson, the new album from Bibio, places him at his best, but leaves room for tailoring for radio success. Rory Foster reviews.

Live Review: The Fall

Having had 60 different members in their 36 year history, how did the current line-up perform? Anwen Baker was there to witness.

Live Review: The Main Stage at YO1 Festival

By James Bithell

Rory Foster reviews the likes of AlunaGeorge and Rudimental at YO1 Festival's Main Stage

Album Review: Noah and the Whale - Heart of Nowhere

By James Bithell

Noah returns with the Whale to bring a brand new LP. Perhaps their biggest fan, Hatti Linnell, has the review you're looking for.

Album Review: The Knife - Shaking the Habitual

By James Bithell

The Swedish pair are back with 'Shaking the Habitual'. Alex Donaldson reviews The Knife's new album

By James Bithell

Bringing out our inner Animaux, Mantas Zalepuga (aka Endeser) launched a beat dropping club night of grime, electronica and bass at the tamed wilderness of York's Duchess.

By James Bithell

Wynn is really good on record but nerves made his gig a little awkward and underwhelming. Hatti Linnell reviews.
